Enjoy your movie time!

I'd highly recommend "The Trouble with Harry" for you! This quirky and intriguing teen drama from 1955 involves a dead body discovered in a New England town, leading to a series of humorous and mysterious events. It features an ensemble cast including Alfred Hitchcock himself.

Alternatively, if you're looking for something with a bit more thrill, "Flatliners" (1990) might be up your alley. It follows five medical students who experiment with near-death experiences and uncover secrets about life and death, starring an impressive cast including Julia Roberts and Kevin Bacon. Enjoy the journey!

Given your preference for war movies and intriguing plots, I'd highly recommend "Catch-22" and "Platoon".

In "Catch-22", you'll find a witty exploration of the absurdity of war as a man tries to be declared insane to avoid missions. It's star-studded with acting greats like Jon Voight, Orson Welles, and Martin Balsam.

"Platoon", on the other hand, offers an intense portrayal of the moral complexity of war through the eyes of a young soldier played by Charlie Sheen. Directed by Oliver Stone, it's a must-watch for its brutal realism. Enjoy your cinematic journey!
